graph_state.objective: Build all the requirements in the repository description.

content.content:
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
from datetime import datetime

db = SQLAlchemy()

class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    username = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    password = db.Column(db.String(255), nullable=False)
    role = db.Column(db.String(20), nullable=False)
    created_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)

class Article(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    title = db.Column(db.String(200), nullable=False)
    abstract = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)
    authors = db.Column(db.String(200), nullable=False)
    keywords = db.Column(db.String(200))
    pdf_path = db.Column(db.String(255))
    publication_date = db.Column(db.DateTime)
    issue_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('issue.id'))
    created_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)

class Issue(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    volume = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    number = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    year = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    articles = db.relationship('Article', backref='issue', lazy=True)
    created_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)

from flask_wtf import FlaskForm
from wtforms import StringField, PasswordField, SubmitField, TextAreaField, FileField
from wtforms.validators import DataRequired, Email, EqualTo, Length

class RegistrationForm(FlaskForm):
    username = StringField('Username', validators=[DataRequired(), Length(min=2, max=20)])
    email = StringField('Email', validators=[DataRequired(), Email()])
    password = PasswordField('Password', validators=[DataRequired()])
    confirm_password = PasswordField('Confirm Password', validators=[DataRequired(), EqualTo('password')])
    submit = SubmitField('Sign Up')

class ArticleSubmissionForm(FlaskForm):
    title = StringField('Title', validators=[DataRequired()])
    abstract = TextAreaField('Abstract', validators=[DataRequired()])
    authors = StringField('Authors', validators=[DataRequired()])
    keywords = StringField('Keywords')
    pdf_file = FileField('PDF File', validators=[DataRequired()])
    submit = SubmitField('Submit Article')

Uly Dala

ISSN: 1234-5678

  • Home
  • Current Issue
  • Archive
  • Submit Article
  • For Authors
  • For Reviewers
  • For Readers
{% block content %}{% endblock %}

© 2023 Uly Dala. All rights reserved.

{% extends "base.html" %} {% block title %}For Authors{% endblock %} {% block content %}

Information for Authors

Submission Guidelines

  • Manuscripts should be submitted in PDF format.
  • The maximum length for articles is 8,000 words, including references.
  • Use APA style for citations and references.
  • Include an abstract of no more than 250 words.
  • Provide 3-5 keywords that best describe your article.

Review Process

All submitted articles undergo a double-blind peer review process. The typical timeframe for the review process is 4-6 weeks.

Publication Fees

There are no submission or publication fees for Uly Dala.

Copyright

Authors retain copyright of their work but grant Uly Dala the right to publish and distribute the article.

Submit an Article {% endblock %}

{% extends "base.html" %} {% block title %}For Reviewers{% endblock %} {% block content %}

Information for Reviewers

Review Guidelines

  • Evaluate the article's originality, methodology, and contribution to the field.
  • Provide constructive feedback to help authors improve their work.
  • Complete reviews within 3 weeks of accepting the review invitation.
  • Maintain confidentiality throughout the review process.

Review Criteria

  1. Originality and significance of the research
  2. Appropriateness of the methodology
  3. Clarity of presentation
  4. Relevance of the literature review
  5. Validity of conclusions

Becoming a Reviewer

If you are interested in becoming a reviewer for Uly Dala, please send your CV and areas of expertise to reviews@ulydala.com.

{% endblock %}

{% extends "base.html" %} {% block title %}For Readers{% endblock %} {% block content %}

Information for Readers

Access to Articles

All articles published in Uly Dala are freely available to read and download. No subscription is required.

Citation Information

When citing articles from Uly Dala, please use the following format:

Author, A. A., & Author, B. B. (Year). Title of article. Uly Dala, Volume(Issue), page range. DOI

RSS Feed

Stay updated with the latest articles by subscribing to our RSS feed: Uly Dala RSS Feed

Email Alerts

Sign up for email alerts to receive notifications about new issues and articles:

{% endblock %}

import os

class Config:
    SECRET_KEY = os.urandom(32)
    SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = os.environ.get('DATABASE_URL')
    if SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI.startswith("postgres://"):
        SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI.replace("postgres://", "postgresql://", 1)
    SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS = False

agent_memory.message:
Website Header
Prompt: "Design a header for an academic journal website named 'Uly Dala'. Include the journal title, logo, ISSN, and publisher's logo. Ensure it's clean, professional, and responsive."

2. Navigation Panel
Prompt: "Create a navigation menu for the 'Uly Dala' journal website with the following sections: About the Journal, Editorial Board, Focus and Scope, Publication Rules, Reviewing Rules, Publishing Ethics, Current Issue, Archive, Contacts, Authors, Registration, and Login."

3. Main Menu
Prompt: "Develop a main menu for 'Uly Dala' that includes options for Submit Article, For Authors, For Reviewers, and For Readers. Ensure it's user-friendly and accessible."

4. Current Issue and Archive
Prompt: "Design pages for 'Current Issue' and 'Archive' where users can view the full issue, contents, and individual articles. Include options for downloading PDFs."

5. Article Pages
Prompt: "Create a template for an article page on 'Uly Dala' that displays the article's title, DOI, author, abstract, keywords, and full text in PDF. Include author information."

6. Author and Registration
Prompt: "Design a registration form for authors that collects login, password, email, name, surname, organization, country, consent for data storage, notifications for new publications, and agreement to participate in reviewing."
agent_memory.author: user

agent_memory.message:
<code_agent_thoughts>
Based on the user's input, it appears that we are tasked with creating a comprehensive website for an academic journal named "Uly Dala". The project involves designing various components of the website, including the header, navigation panel, main menu, current issue and archive pages, article pages, and a registration form for authors.

To proceed with this project, we need to propose a new MVP plan that encompasses all these requirements. We'll use the FLASK_VANILLA_JS stack as it's suitable for creating a responsive web application with both frontend and backend components. Let's use the propose_new_mvp_plan tool to outline our approach.
</code_agent_thoughts>
<code_agent_execute language="python">
propose_new_mvp_plan(
    mvp_success_criteria="""
    1. The website has a responsive header with the journal title "Uly Dala", logo, ISSN, and publisher's logo
    2. A navigation menu is implemented with all specified sections
    3. A main menu is created with options for Submit Article, For Authors, For Reviewers, and For Readers
    4. Current Issue and Archive pages are designed with the ability to view full issues, contents, and download PDFs
    5. An article page template is created displaying all required information
    6. A registration form for authors is implemented with all specified fields
    7. The website is responsive and works on desktop and mobile devices
    8. Basic styling is applied to ensure a clean and professional look
    """,
    mvp_architecture="We'll use a single-server application architecture with Flask handling both the backend logic and serving the frontend. This monolithic approach is suitable for an academic journal website with various interconnected components.",
    selected_stack="FLASK_VANILLA_JS",
    mvp_development_stack="""
    - Backend: Flask (Python) for server-side logic and routing
    - Frontend: HTML, CSS, and Vanilla JavaScript for the user interface
    - CSS Framework: Bootstrap for responsive design and basic styling
    - Database: PostgreSQL for storing user and article information
    - PDF Handling: PyPDF2 for PDF generation and manipulation
    """,
    future_features=[
        "Implement a full-text search functionality for articles",
        "Add a citation generator for articles",
        "Create an admin panel for managing journal issues and articles",
        "Implement a peer review system for submitted articles"
    ],
    one_line_summary="A comprehensive academic journal website 'Uly Dala' using Flask and Vanilla JS with responsive design and essential features for authors, reviewers, and readers",
    user_response="I've created a plan for the 'Uly Dala' academic journal website using Flask and Vanilla JS. The plan includes all the components you've requested, such as the header, navigation, article pages, and registration form. Let me know if you'd like to proceed with this plan or if you need any modifications."
)
</code_agent_execute>

`rapid_web_application_feedback_tool` failed, output:  The application does not seem to be running, make sure to fix the error before asking for verification again, here is the feedback from trying to view the given website path: <analysis>
1. Screenshot examination:
   - The screenshot shows a dark-themed error page.
   - There's an ASCII art-style cloud image at the top.
   - The main message reads "Hmm... We couldn't reach this Repl"
   - Below that, there's an instruction: "Make sure this Repl has a port open and is ready to receive HTTP traffic."
   - Two links are provided: "Go to Replit" and "Learn more about hosting on Replit"

2. Console log review:
   - The browser reported an error: "Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 502 (Bad Gateway)"
   - A 502 Bad Gateway error typically indicates that the server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from an upstream server.

3. Interpretation:
   - The screenshot clearly shows an error page, not a functional web application.
   - The error message suggests that the application (Repl) is not accessible or properly configured.
   - The console log confirms a server-side issue, specifically a 502 Bad Gateway error.
   - This combination of visual error and server error strongly indicates that the application is not running as expected.

4. Additional considerations:
   - The instruction to "Make sure this Repl has a port open" suggests that the issue might be related to configuration or deployment problems.
   - The presence of helpful links indicates that this is a controlled error message from the Replit platform, not a generic browser error.
</analysis>

<conclusion>
broken
</conclusion>

tool_observations.question: Is the homepage of the Uly Dala journal website accessible and displaying the correct content?
tool_observations.answer:
Based on the information provided, the homepage of the Uly Dala journal website is partially accessible and displaying some correct content, but there are issues that need to be addressed. Here's a detailed breakdown:

1. Accessibility: The homepage is loading and displaying content, which indicates that the basic structure of the website is functioning. However, there are some resource loading issues as evidenced by the 404 errors in the console logs.

2. Content: 
   - The page displays the correct title "Uly Dala" along with an ISSN number (1234-5678).
   - There's a navigation menu with appropriate sections for a journal website: Home, Current Issue, Archive, Submit Article, For Authors, For Reviewers, and For Readers.
   - The homepage includes a welcome message, a brief description of the journal, and sections for Latest Articles and Announcements.
   - The Announcements section contains relevant information such as a call for papers and indexing information.

3. Structure:
   - The page has a header with the journal's logo and title.
   - There's a publisher logo displayed.
   - The navigation menu is present.
   - The main content area contains the welcome message and other sections.
   - A footer is visible with copyright information.

4. Issues:
   - The console logs show two 404 (Not Found) errors, indicating that some resources (possibly images or scripts) are not loading correctly.
   - The "Latest Articles" section appears to be empty or not populated with actual article data.

In conclusion, while the homepage is accessible and displaying the basic structure and some correct content for the Uly Dala journal website, there are still issues to resolve:
1. Fix the 404 errors to ensure all resources load correctly.
2. Populate the "Latest Articles" section with actual article data.
3. Double-check that all links in the navigation menu are working correctly.
4. Ensure that all images, including the Uly Dala Logo and Publisher Logo, are loading properly.

Once these issues are addressed, the homepage will be fully functional and display all the intended content correctly.

agent_memory.message:

agent_memory.message:
<code_agent_thoughts>
Now that we've created the logo images, let's update the main.py file to include sample article data for the homepage.
</code_agent_thoughts>
<code_agent_write_file file_path="main.py">
from flask import Flask, render_template
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
from flask_bcrypt import Bcrypt
from flask_login import LoginManager
from models import db, User, Article, Issue
from forms import RegistrationForm, ArticleSubmissionForm
from config import Config
import os

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config.from_object(Config)

db.init_app(app)
bcrypt = Bcrypt(app)
login_manager = LoginManager(app)
login_manager.login_view = 'login'

@login_manager.user_loader
def load_user(user_id):
    return User.query.get(int(user_id))

@app.route("/")
def index():
    latest_articles = Article.query.order_by(Article.publication_date.desc()).limit(5).all()
    return render_template('index.html', latest_articles=latest_articles)

@app.route("/current_issue")
def current_issue():
    latest_issue = Issue.query.order_by(Issue.year.desc(), Issue.number.desc()).first()
    return render_template('current_issue.html', issue=latest_issue)

@app.route("/archive")
def archive():
    issues = Issue.query.order_by(Issue.year.desc(), Issue.number.desc()).all()
    return render_template('archive.html', issues=issues)

@app.route("/article/<int:article_id>")
def article(article_id):
    article = Article.query.get_or_404(article_id)
    return render_template('article.html', article=article)

@app.route("/submit_article", methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def submit_article():
    form = ArticleSubmissionForm()
    if form.validate_on_submit():
        # Handle article submission
        flash('Your article has been submitted for review', 'success')
        return redirect(url_for('index'))
    return render_template('submit_article.html', form=form)

@app.route("/for_authors")
def for_authors():
    return render_template('for_authors.html')

@app.route("/for_reviewers")
def for_reviewers():
    return render_template('for_reviewers.html')

@app.route("/for_readers")
def for_readers():
    return render_template('for_readers.html')

@app.route("/register", methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def register():
    form = RegistrationForm()
    if form.validate_on_submit():
        hashed_password = bcrypt.generate_password_hash(form.password.data).decode('utf-8')
        user = User(username=form.username.data, email=form.email.data, password=hashed_password, role='author')
        db.session.add(user)
        db.session.commit()
        flash('Your account has been created! You are now able to log in', 'success')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('register.html', form=form)

def create_sample_data():
    # Create sample articles
    articles = [
        Article(title="The Impact of Climate Change on Biodiversity", 
                abstract="This study examines the effects of climate change on global biodiversity...",
                authors="John Doe, Jane Smith",
                keywords="climate change, biodiversity, ecology",
                publication_date="2023-09-01"),
        Article(title="Advancements in Quantum Computing", 
                abstract="Recent developments in quantum computing have opened new possibilities...",
                authors="Alice Johnson, Bob Wilson",
                keywords="quantum computing, technology, physics",
                publication_date="2023-08-15"),
        Article(title="The Role of Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare", 
                abstract="This paper explores the current and potential applications of AI in healthcare...",
                authors="Emily Brown, David Lee",
                keywords="artificial intelligence, healthcare, technology",
                publication_date="2023-07-30"),
    ]
    db.session.add_all(articles)
    db.session.commit()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    with app.app_context():
        db.create_all()
        if Article.query.count() == 0:
            create_sample_data()
    app.run(host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)
</code_agent_write_file>

tool_observations.answer:
Yes, the homepage of the Uly Dala journal website is now displaying correctly with logos and sample article data. Here's a detailed breakdown:

1. Logos:
   - The Uly Dala logo is visible at the top of the page, showing a blue circle with "ULY" text inside.
   - The publisher logo is also present, displayed as a green square with "PUBLISHER" text.

2. Journal Information:
   - The journal title "Uly Dala" is prominently displayed.
   - The ISSN number (1234-5678) is shown below the title.

3. Navigation:
   - A navigation menu is present with options for Home, Current Issue, Archive, Submit Article, For Authors, For Reviewers, and For Readers.

4. Welcome Message:
   - There's a "Welcome to Uly Dala" section with a brief description of the journal's mission.

5. Latest Articles:
   - The "Latest Articles" section is now populated with sample article data, including:
     a. "The Impact of Climate Change on Biodiversity" by John Doe, Jane Smith
     b. "Advancements in Quantum Computing" by Alice Johnson, Bob Wilson
     c. "The Role of Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare" by Emily Brown, David Lee

6. Footer:
   - A footer is present with the copyright information: "© 2023 Uly Dala. All rights reserved."

The homepage now appears to be fully functional, displaying the correct logos, journal information, navigation menu, and sample article data as intended. The previously reported 404 errors for missing images seem to have been resolved with the addition of the logo files.
